how_to_use: Apply to clean skin after toner. Leave on for 10 minutes. Remove and pat remaining essence into the face, neck, and décolleté.

name: Bifida Biome Aqua Barrier Cream
text:
Ma:nyo – Bifida Biome Aqua Barrier Cream

Our bodies host countless beneficial bacteria. When supported, they help protect us from harmful microorganisms. This cream works on a similar principle: probiotics/ferments form a large part of the formula and help support the skin microbiome and create a protective lipid-like barrier.

With Bifida Biome Aqua Barrier, your skin’s comfort zone gets extra support.

Composition/INCI: Tromethamine, Dimethicone, Ethylhexylglycerin, Panthenol, Propanediol, Adenosine, Dextrin, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Niacinamide, Sodium Hyaluronate, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Water, Hyacinth Extract, Glucose, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Sage Extract, Xanthan Gum, Bifida Ferment Lysate, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Lavender Extract, Ceramide NP, Hyaluronic Acid, Tocopherol, Fructose, Squalane, Hydrogenated Olive Oil Unsaponifiables, Artemisia Extract, Lactobacillus Ferment Lysate, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Lactobacillus Ferment, Isononyl Isononanoate, Guar Gum, Agar, Hydrolyzed Glycosaminoglycans, 1,2-Hexanediol, Centella Extract, Lactobacillus/Fermented Pumpkin Fruit Filtrate, Licorice Extract, Witch Hazel Extract, Cynanchum Extract, Anastatica Hierochuntica Extract, Chrysanthemum Extract, Motherwort Extract, Cornflower Extract, Chamomile Flower/Leaf Extract, Chlorella Extract, Pentaerythrityl Tetraethylhexanoate, Cotton Extract, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Cocoa Bean Extract, Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Dimethyl Sulfone, Betaine Salicylate, Polyglyceryl-3 Methylglucose Distearate, Saccharomyces Ferment Filtrate, Pentylene Glycol, Bifida Ferment Filtrate, Lactococcus Ferment Lysate, Cyperus Extract, Evening Primrose Extract, Pine Leaf Extract, Pueraria Extract, Japanese Elm Extract, Borage Extract, Fructooligosaccharide, Peony Extract, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Polydecene, Benzyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Madecassic Acid, Asiaticoside, Asiatic Acid, Cutibacterium Granulosum Ferment Extract (10,000 ppm)
how_to_use: Apply a sufficient amount to the face, neck, and décolleté as the final step of your routine.

name: Skinny Fit Slim Pencil
text:
IM'UNNY — Skinny Fit Slim Pencil

If you’ve been looking for a reliable everyday eyeliner pencil that also works for evening makeup—this is it.

Skinny Fit Slim Pencil is a waterproof eyeliner designed to create a defined look: from a subtle tightline between lashes to bold wings.

It’s made for non-pro users, so you don’t need weeks of practice. The ultra-slim tip helps draw a clean line even if you’re new to eyeliner. The soft gel texture with a quick-setting base is comfortable and does not feel harsh. No sharpening needed.

Product features:
- Ultra-slim 2 mm tip to fill the lash line and waterline area more precisely.
- Long wear up to 24 hours and water resistance. The improved formula also helps absorb excess sebum and forms a film to reduce smudging.
- Sets quickly, while still allowing time to smudge for a natural smoky effect.

Composition/INCI: Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Methyl Trimethicone, Carnauba Wax, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Polyethylene, Synthetic Wax, Mica (CI 77019), Cetyl Alcohol, Cyclopentasiloxane, Acrylates/Stearyl Acrylate/Dimethicone Methacrylate Copolymer, Methicone, Ceresin, Diisostearyl Malate, Dimethicone, Iron Oxides (CI 77491)
how_to_use: Draw along the lash line, extending a wing from the outer corner if desired. Smudge if needed to soften. Do not press too hard—the 2 mm tip can break with excessive pressure.

name: Centella HA Serum
text:
Cos de BAHA – Centella HA Serum

In action movies, there’s often a healer who helps the hero recover after a battle—usually with herbs, not pills. In this story, your face is the hero (fighting city pollution, dry office air, UV exposure), and Centella HA Serum is the healer.

Centella Asiatica extract is known for skin-repair support, helping calm visible redness and prepare the skin for the next day.

Composition/INCI: Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Betaine, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Momordica Charantia Fruit Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Leontopodium Alpinum Extract, Sambucus Extract, 1,2-Hexanediol, Centella Asiatica Extract
how_to_use: After cleansing (and toner), apply a small amount to the face. Follow with moisturizer.

name: Derma Nature Fresh Blackhead Jojoba Cleansing Oil
text:
Celimax — Derma Nature Fresh Blackhead Jojoba Cleansing Oil

We do not recommend skipping removal of sunscreen—this is a common reason for inflammation, acne, and breakouts, as the invisible film can clog pores. A cleansing oil helps dissolve sunscreen and makeup, and can also remove lip and eye makeup.

Its lipophilic phase dissolves oil-based impurities, and when emulsified with water it helps rinse away residue. This also helps remove excess sebum, supporting the look of fewer blackheads and less shine.

A rich blend of oils softens the skin and helps prevent flaking. The formula supports a healthier hydrolipid balance, helping reduce post-cleansing dryness.

With daily use, the number of breakouts can appear reduced. Best for oily, combination, and blemish-prone skin; not recommended for dehydrated skin.

Key ingredients: Grapeseed Oil; Olive Oil; Apricot Kernel Oil; Jojoba Seed Oil; Meadowfoam Seed Oil

Composition/INCI: Olive Oil, Apricot Kernel Oil, Meadowfoam Seed Oil, Sweet Almond Oil, Jojoba Seed Oil (1500 ppm), Ethyl Alcohol, Pulsatilla Koreana Extract, Sorbeth-30 Tetraoleate, Linalool, Grapeseed Oil, Bergamot Essential Oil, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Limonene, Sunflower Seed Oil, 1,2-Hexanediol, Usnea Barbata Extract, Water, Green Tea Leaf Extract, Zanthoxylum Fruit Extract
how_to_use: Dispense a small amount into your hands and apply to dry facial skin. Massage for 1–2 minutes. Wet hands to emulsify into a milky texture, then rinse with warm water and follow with a foaming cleanser. Patch test before first use. Tip: applying to steamed skin can help cleanse pores more deeply.

name: Galactomy Enzyme Peeling Gel (mini)
text:
Ma:nyo — Galactomy Enzyme Peeling Gel (mini)

An enzyme peeling gel with Galactomyces that helps refresh the skin by gently exfoliating dead cells—supporting a cleaner look, improved firmness, and radiance. Helps with the look of enlarged pores, excess shine, breakouts, and pigmentation.

Enzymes act more gently than AHA/BHA acids. With water, they help loosen bonds between dead surface cells so they can be removed more comfortably.

Key ingredients: Papain; Galactomyces Ferment Filtrate; Cellulose

how_to_use: Apply to clean, damp skin and massage until “pilling” forms, focusing on areas that need extra cleansing. Rinse thoroughly with warm water.

name: Barrier Enhancing Toner to Essence
text:
Rawquest — Barrier Enhancing Toner to Essence

Your skincare shelf will squeal just from the packaging alone. This toner-essence is unique because it combines two steps at once: toning and nourishing, thanks to its active-rich formula.

It helps strengthen the skin barrier, nourish and hydrate, and support moisture retention for a healthier hydrolipid balance throughout the day.

The thicker texture feels more like an essence: it melts into the skin, absorbs quickly, and leaves no sticky residue or greasy film.

It’s especially helpful during winter temperature swings. Frequent transitions from dry, heated indoor air to cold wind can compromise the barrier, causing redness and flaking. This product aims to support calm, comfortable skin.

Suitable for all skin types, particularly dry, dehydrated, and sensitive skin with a weakened barrier.

Key ingredients: Glucose; Watercress Extract; Panthenol; Ivy Extract; Osmanthus Fragrans Flower Extract

Composition/INCI: Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Nasturtium Officinale (Watercress) Extract, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Hydroxyacetophenone, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Glucose, Disodium EDTA, Cocoa Extract, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Acetyl Glutamine, Panthenol, Glycereth-25 PCA Isostearate, Fructan, Sodium Hyaluronate, Zea Mays (Corn) Extract, Osmanthus Fragrans Flower Extract, Trideceth-10, Amyris Balsamifera Bark Oil, Squalane, Cellulose Gum, Hyaluronic Acid, Dipotassium Phosphate, Strawberry Fruit Extract, Coconut Oil, Ammonium Polyacryloyldimethyl Taurate, Propanediol, Banana Extract, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Polyacryloyldimethyl Taurate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Water, Dipropylene Glycol, Sucrose Distearate, Gardenia Florida Extract, Erythritol, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Hedera Helix (Ivy) Leaf/Stem Extract, Glycerin
how_to_use: After cleansing, apply a small amount to dry skin with gentle massage using palms. For deeper hydration, apply 2 layers. As a targeted calming mask: soak cotton pads (not fluffy cotton!) and apply to areas for 5–10 minutes. Patch test before first use.

name: Echinacea Airy Sun Stick SPF50+ PA++++
text:
RAWQUEST — Echinacea Airy Sun Stick SPF50+ PA++++

Approach the spring–summer season wisely—meaning with proper sun protection. This easy-to-use sun stick makes it simple. Its airy texture glides onto the skin in a light, breathable layer for a fresh, comfortable UV shield. The formula uses modern broad-spectrum chemical filters to protect from both UVA and UVB rays.

The stick contains a patented moisturizing agent (188Da). Its molecules are smaller than skin pores, which helps it penetrate deeper into the epidermis and reduce moisture loss.

The gentle formula is suitable for sensitive skin: it helps calm the skin, improves the look of pores, and helps control excess sebum. You can also use it under makeup—foundation applies well on top, and the stick itself does not leave an overly greasy shine.

How to use: Apply to areas of the face or body exposed to UV rays. If you are in the sun for a long time, reapply every 2–3 hours.

Key ingredients: Damask Rose Flower Oil; Echinacea Purpurea Extract; Tocopherol; Palmarosa Oil

Composition/INCI: Tocopherol, Ethylhexyl Methoxycinnamate, Damascus Rose Flower Oil, Octocrylene, Limonene, Red Clover Extract, Citral, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ozokerite, Tocopheryl Acetate, Silica, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Alpha-Bisabolol, Cellulose Gum, Synthetic Wax, Bis-Ethylhexyl Oxyphe-nyl Methoxyphenyl Triazine, Butylene Glycol Dicaprylate/Dicaprate, Geraniol, Butylene Glycol, Purified Water, Acetylglutamine, Orange Peel Oil, Echinacea Extract (0.05 ppm), Sodium Hyaluronate, Dehydroacetic Acid, Methyl Propanediol, Lauryl Polyglyceryl-3 Polydimethylsiloxy Ethyl Dimethicone, Methyl Methacrylate Crosspolymer, Linalool, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Dimethicone, Diethylamino Hydroxybenzoyl Hexyl Benzoate, Glycerin, Dipotassium Phosphate, Ethylhexyl Salicylate, Vinyl Dimethicone/Methicone Silsesquioxane Crosspolymer, Palmarosa Oil, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Sodium Acetylated Hyaluronate
how_to_use: Apply to areas of the face or body exposed to UV rays. If you are in the sun for a long time, reapply every 2–3 hours.

name: Canna Barrier Gel Cream
text:
VivLas — Canna Barrier Gel Cream

Cannabis (hemp) has far more benefits than the one people usually joke about—it's also a valuable cosmetic ingredient. This lightweight gel-cream does not leave stickiness or greasy shine. It helps restore and refresh the skin thanks to a combination of proven natural components, ceramides, and gentle acids.

— The base of the formula is hemp seed oil. Hemp seeds contain amino acids and vitamins A, E, C, and B, and are rich in magnesium, phosphorus, zinc, and iron. This “vitamin boost” helps support the hydrolipid balance. The oil also contains gamma-linolenic acid, which is known for its supportive role in very dry, reactive skin and helps prevent dryness by sealing moisture in.

Recommended use:
Suitable for sensitive, combination, and dehydrated skin with early signs of aging. Ideal for daily use. After cleansing and toning, apply a small amount to the face and neck with gentle massage movements.

Key ingredients: Ceramide Complex; Centella Asiatica; Cannabidiol; Hemp Seed Oil

Composition/INCI: Fragrance, Cholesterol, Niacinamide, Angelica Archangelica Root Extract, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Disodium EDTA, Cannabis Sativa (Hemp) Seed Oil, Water, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Ceramide AP, Ceramide NP, Lonicera Japonica (Honeysuckle) Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Conifer Leaf Extract, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Dextrin, Glycereth-26, Vinyl Dimethicone, Morus Alba Flower Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Portulaca Oleracea Extract, Butylene Glycol, Hyaluronic Acid, Nepeta Cataria Extract, Geranium Extract, Propanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Cetearyl Olivate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Uncaria Tomentosa (Cat's Claw) Extract, Tricholoma Matsutake Extract, Morinda Citrifolia Leaf Extract, Sorbitan Olivate, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Extract, Adenosine, Laurus Nobilis Leaf Extract, Agrimonia Eupatoria Leaf Extract, Tromethamine, Centella Asiatica Extract, Glycerin, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid
how_to_use: Suitable for sensitive, combination, and dehydrated skin with early signs of aging. Ideal for daily use. After cleansing and toning, apply a small amount to the face and neck with gentle massage movements.

name: Pure Enzyme Cleansing Water
text:
Ma:nyo — Pure Enzyme Cleansing Water

Removes everything unnecessary and leaves skin perfectly clean, soft, and comfortably hydrated. Meet Ma:nyo’s enzyme cleansing water for makeup removal. It gently handles even long-wear makeup, softly exfoliates dead skin cells, and cleanses the skin from impurities, dust, and excess sebum.

The key actives here are enzymes. Enzymes help dissolve oily residues and also show hydrophilic properties. The water helps reduce moisture loss, supports an optimal pH balance around 5.5, and improves the look of tone and texture. Patented natural components leave the skin comfortable—no dryness or tightness.

The brand reports validated performance: KC Skin Research Center confirmed removal of up to 98.187% of irritant particles accumulated on the face during the day. Thanks to gentle calendula, the product can be used for all skin types, including sensitive skin—especially recommended for sensitive skin.

Key ingredients: Mistletoe Extract; Lactobacillus Ferment; Multi-Molecular Hyaluronic Acid Complex (7 types); Imperata Cylindrica Extract; Calendula; Papain

Composition/INCI: Carica Papaya (Papaya) Fruit Extract, Hydroxyacetophenone, Papain, Glucose, Disodium EDTA, Xylitylglucoside, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Maltodextrin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Calendula Extract, Xylitol, Potassium Hyaluronate, Hyaluronic Acid, Hydroxypropyltrimonium Hyaluronate, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Anhydroxylitol, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Acetylated Hyaluronate, PEG-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Water, Fermented Soybean Extract (Lactobacillus Ferment), Dipropylene Glycol, PEG-6 Caprylic/Capric Glycerides, Glycerin, Saccharomyces/Imperata Cylindrica Root Extract, Mistletoe Extract
how_to_use: Saturate a cotton pad with the required amount and wipe the entire face, including the eye and lip area. To dissolve long-wear makeup, press the cotton pad onto the skin for 5–10 seconds, then gently wipe.

name: Special Relief Foil Mask
text:
HUEBACK — Special Relief Foil Mask

A sheet mask based on therapeutic mineral spring water for intensive hydration and to help reduce redness and inflammation. The mask has a three-layer structure:

1) A gold foil layer that helps lock in moisture and actives while still allowing the skin to breathe
2) An elastic fabric layer that helps distribute the mask evenly
3) A thin inner layer that adheres closely to the skin

The formula features dimethyl sulfone (MSM), a non-metal sulfur compound commonly found in nature. It provides a strong soothing effect and is often used in products designed to support problematic, reactive skin. Formulas with MSM are sometimes referred to as “cosmeceutical” due to higher active concentrations and performance-oriented positioning.

Composition/INCI: Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Hydroxyacetophenone, Cholesterol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Benzyl Glycol, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Disodium EDTA, Dipropylene Glycol, Betaine, Water, PVM/MA Copolymer, Sodium Hyaluronate, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Dimethyl Sulfone, Stearic Acid, Methylpropanediol, Carbomer, Butylene Glycol, Hyaluronic Acid, Adenosine, Ceramide NP, Polyglyceryl-10 Laurate, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Atelocollagen, Allantoin, Hydrolyzed Glycosaminoglycans, Algin, Serine, Sugarcane Extract, Xanthan Gum, Ceramide IO, Sodium Citrate, Hydrolyzed Collagen, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ceramide APF, Pumpkin Extract, Cetearyl Alcohol, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Cypress Water, Tromethamine, Raspberry Ketone, Glycerin, Phytosphingosine, Ceramide NS, Water-Soluble Proteoglycan, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid
how_to_use: Apply to clean skin for 10–20 minutes, then pat the remaining essence over the face and neck. Important: the mask is not recommended if you have rosacea.

name: Real Niacinamide Glow Up Daily Mask
text:
NEOGEN — Real Niacinamide Glow Up Daily Mask

A daily hydrating pad mask with niacinamide that brings back brightness and bounce to dull, dehydrated skin. It helps retain water and delivers up to 6× more essence compared to many standard daily masks.

The product has a calming effect, helps reduce irritation, targets post-acne marks and pigmentation, and helps protect the skin from environmental stressors.

Thanks to the large size of the soft cotton pads, you can cover broader areas such as the forehead and cheeks. The pads help reduce reactivity, ease discomfort, and support recovery. Even after a long time, skin can remain hydrated, smooth, and radiant.

Key ingredients: Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract; Sodium Hyaluronate; Tea Tree Leaf Oil; Ceramide NP; Rosa Damascena Flower Water; Centella Asiatica Extract; Niacinamide

Composition/INCI: Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Water, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Polysorbate 60, Azadirachta Indica Leaf Extract, Melissa Officinalis Flower/Leaf/Stem Water, Propanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, 1,2-Hexanediol, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Artemisia Annua Extract, Pulsatilla Koreana Extract, Phytosteryl/Octyldodecyl Lauroyl Glutamate, Dipropylene Glycol, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Extract, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Usnea Barbata (Lichen) Extract, Water, Ceramide NP, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Helichrysum Arenarium Extract, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Oil, Ethylhexylglycerin, Tromethamine, Symphytum Officinale Leaf Extract, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Flower Water, Aniba Rosodora (Rosewood) Wood Oil, Centella Asiatica Extract, Rosa Damascena Flower Water, Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract, Glycerin, Xanthan Gum, Niacinamide, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree) Leaf Extract, Zanthoxylum Piperitum Fruit Extract, Calendula Officinalis Extract, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Houttuynia Cordata Extract, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Carbomer, Helichrysum Italicum Flower Water
how_to_use: Apply the pads to cleansed skin prepped with toner—place on the forehead and cheeks and leave for 10–20 minutes. Use as a daily mask (one pad per area). Follow with a moisturizer.

name: Scalp Care Shampoo
text:
Groyella — Scalp Care Shampoo

Groyella shampoo is designed to become a staple on a men’s grooming shelf: it provides reliable cleansing and care for both hair and scalp. The formula helps regulate sebum secretion, reducing root buildup.

Male scalp physiology and higher physical activity can contribute to faster oiliness due to increased sebum production. At the same time, moisturizing ingredients help maintain comfortable hydration and help prevent flaking/crusting.

The shampoo contains the patented peptide complex EMortalPEP™, aimed at supporting hair follicle activity. It helps strengthen hair structure from roots to ends, helping reduce shedding and breakage. Hair looks stronger, healthier, and more resilient.

It creates a rich foam and is economical to use. Suitable for daily use for all hair types; it does not overdry the scalp and is designed to be non-irritating.

Key ingredients: Shea Butter; Peppermint Oil; Panthenol; Eucalyptus Leaf Extract; Korean Raspberry Root Extract

Composition/INCI: Hexamidine Diisethionate, Corallina Extract, PEG-120 Methyl Glucose Dioleate, Peppermint Oil, Red Onion Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Bergamot Oil, Cocamide MEA, Disodium EDTA, Glycol Distearate, Trihydroxystearin, Disodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Polyquaternium-22, Clove Flower Extract, Betaine, Panthenol, Propylene Glycol, Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Disodium Laureth Sulfosuccinate, Tocopherol, Caprylyl Glycol, Polyquaternium-7, PEG-150 Distearate, Shea Butter, Grapefruit Extract, Sophora Root Extract, Linalool, Yuzu Fruit Extract, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Lavender Oil, Citric Acid, Pea Peptides, Propanediol, Limonene, Sunflower Seed Oil, Neem Leaf Extract, Butylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Water, Korean Raspberry Root Extract, Acrylates Copolymer, Sodium Chloride, Turmeric Root Extract, Turmeric Root Oil, Cocamide DEA, Sodium Benzoate, Neem Flower Extract, Arginine, Eucalyptus Leaf Extract, Glycerin, Lauryl Hydroxysultaine, Basil Leaf Extract
how_to_use: Apply the required amount to the scalp. Massage for 1–2 minutes and rinse thoroughly with warm water. No conditioner is needed, as conditioning components are already included.

name: Emollient Bath Oil
text:
Cellbrick — Emollient Bath Oil

Barummedi was founded in 2010 by an experienced dermatologist (20+ years of practice) and focuses on cosmeceuticals and pharmaceuticals. Cellbrick is a line designed to hydrate and strengthen the skin barrier, built around a nano multi-layer lamellar technology. This structure is close to the skin’s own barrier architecture, helping the formula interact more effectively and support longer-lasting hydration.

This emollient oil gently cleanses even very sensitive skin of the face and body and supports restoration of the water-lipid balance. It contains 76% natural oils:

- Sunflower seed oil 33% — rich in vitamins and beneficial fatty acids
- Castor oil 16% — helps reduce moisture loss
- Other oils 27%

Immediate benefits:
- gentle cleansing
- helps reduce irritation and itching
- helps prevent flaking
- helps retain moisture

Suitable for children’s care; appropriate for atopic skin and conditions such as eczema and dermatitis.

Composition/INCI: Tocopherol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, MIPA-Laureth Sulfate, Laureth-3, Castor Oil, Sunflower Seed Oil, Laureth-7 Citrate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Water, Hydrogenated Palm Glycerides Citrate
how_to_use: 1) To remove makeup or sunscreen from the face: apply to dry skin with massaging movements, avoiding the eye area, then rinse with warm water (the oil transforms into a milky emulsion). Rinse thoroughly. 2) As a shower cleanser, especially for those with skin conditions or after prolonged sun exposure/sunburn. Apply directly to wet body skin, then rinse thoroughly. 3) As a bath foam: add under running water, then rinse with clean water after bathing. Suitable for babies, including newborns.

name: Vinegar Kombucha Essence
text:
Juice To Cleanse — Vinegar Kombucha Essence

Kombucha—the beauty-market superstar—stars as the main ingredient in this well-known essence from Juice To Cleanse. The brand is known for a cold-press extraction process at 4°C (like fresh juice), which helps preserve the properties of fruit extracts while reducing unnecessary byproducts.

This serum-essence helps restore elasticity, supports cell renewal, deeply nourishes, and smooths the appearance of fine lines.

Kombucha is fermented tea (yes, the same drink many of us had in childhood). As an antioxidant, it helps neutralize free radicals that contribute to aging. In combination with pineapple and apple extracts, it supports recovery after UV exposure and strengthens the skin’s protective functions.

The vegan formula also includes PHA (polyhydroxy acids), which provide a gentler exfoliation than many AHA acids due to larger molecular size.

The formula pH is 4.5, making it suitable for all skin types, including sensitive skin. The essence contains no artificial fragrances or dyes.

Key ingredients: Apple Extract; Amino Acid Complex (6 types); Multi-Molecular Hyaluronic Acid Complex (3 types); Lactobionic Acid; FUCOIN™ Complex; Pineapple Extract; Kombucha Essence (84%)

Composition/INCI: Hydroxyacetophenone, Niacinamide, Histidine, Biosaccharide Gum-1, Disodium EDTA, Linalool, Methionine, Pelargonium Graveolens (Geranium) Flower Oil, Dipropylene Glycol, Limonene, Glycereth-25 PCA Isostearate, Tyrosine, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Juice, Sodium Hyaluronate, Aloe Leaf Juice, Dextrin, Carbomer, Capryloyl Salicylic Acid, Orange Peel Oil, Tea Tree Leaf Oil, Cauliflower Extract, Hyaluronic Acid, Vinegar, Adenosine, Citric Acid, Alanine, Saccharomyces/Xylinum/Fermented Black Tea, Propanediol, Lavender Oil, Apple Extract, Sodium Citrate, Butylene Glycol, Rosemary Leaf Oil, 1,2-Hexanediol, Pear Fruit Extract, Lactobionic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin, Water, Leucine, Cocoa Seed Extract, Tromethamine, Arginine, Ectoin, Cabbage Leaf Extract, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid
how_to_use: Apply 2–3 drops to cleansed face and neck after toner and allow to absorb. Finish with a moisturizer. Use morning and evening.

name: Truffle Water Ceramide Cream
text:
Jenny House — Truffle Water Ceramide Cream

Jenny House is more than just a skincare brand—its founders are professional makeup artists and owners of one of Korea’s top beauty salons. Many customers first fell in love with the brand’s cushion foundation; next up is this hydrating cream featuring an exclusive French black truffle extract.

The formula supports skin firmness and provides anti-age care for dehydrated skin while helping maintain the hydrolipid balance.

Brightening and tone-evening benefits are supported by the patented ingredient MADE WHITE, featuring madecassoside (a Centella active). It supports skin recovery and helps improve the look of tone and texture.

The formula also includes a комплексный Centella component (CICAIDE) combining Centella actives and peptide ingredients to support collagen and elastin synthesis for a more resilient feel.

Key ingredients: Black Truffle Extract; Centella Asiatica; Ceramide NP

Composition/INCI: Aureobasidium Pullulans Ferment Extract, Acrylate/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Ethylhexylglycerin, Madecassoside, Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ceramide NS, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Aureobasidium Pullulans Ferment Filtrate, Panthenol, Ceramide NP (1,000 ppm), Cetearyl Alcohol, Centella Asiatica Leaf Extract, Cyclotetrasiloxane, Ceramide AS, Cranberry Extract, Black Truffle Extract (10,000 ppm), Caprylyl Methicone, Ocimum Sanctum Leaf Extract, Butylene Glycol, Cyclopentasiloxane, Disodium EDTA, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Ceramide AP, Pentylene Glycol, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Tromethamine, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Centella Asiatica Extract, Centella Asiatica Root Extract, Water, Glycerin, Xanthan Gum, Stearic Acid, Carrot Seed Oil, Niacinamide, Phytosphingosine, Apple Extract, Cholesterol
how_to_use: Apply the required amount to cleansed, prepped facial skin. Suitable for both morning and evening use.

name: Dokdo Toner
text:
ROUND LAB — Dokdo Toner

A true superstar among toners and a multi-year beauty award winner. This hydrating toner provides a gentle exfoliating effect.

The hero ingredient is the patented Hatching EX07 complex sourced from deep, pristine waters near Ulleungdo Island. This mineral-rich water helps support the skin’s water-lipid balance and contains 74 minerals preserved through a specialized nano-filtration membrane technology.

The toner also includes panthenol, allantoin, and betaine to calm irritated skin and support sensitive skin against external stressors.

Clinically tested for hypoallergenicity, it deeply hydrates while gently lifting dead skin cells, helps regulate sebum production, and leaves no sticky residue.

It can also be used as a compress mask on especially irritated or dry areas: saturate cotton pads and apply to the area for 10 minutes.

Composition/INCI: Mineral Water, Pentylene Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Betaine, Panthenol, Allantoin, Butylene Glycol, Irish Moss Extract, Protease, Propanediol, Sugarcane Extract, 1,2-Hexanediol, Disodium EDTA, Water, Xanthan Gum, Glycerin
how_to_use: After cleansing, apply to dry skin with patting motions or apply to a cotton pad and swipe over the face. For extra hydration, use cotton pads as a compress on dry areas for 5–10 minutes.

name: Hyaluronic Acid Toner (Mini)
text:
IsNtree — Hyaluronic Acid Toner (Mini)

In Korea, truly hydrated skin is hard to achieve without a toner—this step is present in most routines. Here we have IsNtree’s bestselling toner, a next-generation formula built around three types of hyaluronic acid.

IsNtree products are certified by Korea’s Ministry of Food and Drug Safety, reflecting high standards in manufacturing and raw material sourcing.

The idea is that a blend of hyaluronic acid molecules of different sizes absorbs quickly and helps hydrate multiple layers of the skin, supporting a plumper look.

Hydration is enhanced by a patented natural complex: aloe juice and hollyhock (Althaea rosea) extract. In addition to hydration, this botanical has notable soothing properties.

The brand reports research-backed performance: testing during development indicated the toner is hypoallergenic and non-irritating, and a study showed skin hydration increased by 34% compared to baseline.

Key ingredients: Hyaluronic Acid Complex (3 types); Aloe Vera Juice; Althaea Rosea (Hollyhock) Extract

Composition/INCI: Usnea Barbata (Lichen) Extract, Pulsatilla Koreana Extract, Panthenol, Soluble Collagen, Water, Trehalose, Zanthoxylum Piperitum Fruit Extract, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Butylene Glycol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Althaea Rosea Flower Extract, Betula Alba Juice, Glycerin, Portulaca Oleracea Extract, Beta-Glucan
how_to_use: Soak a cotton pad and gently swipe over clean, dry facial skin in circular motions. Allow to absorb fully, then apply essence and/or moisturizer.

name: Lemon Vitamin Toner
text:
Glow — Lemon Vitamin Toner

A brightening toner with lemon water from Jeju Island. The fresh citrus scent and weightless texture turn toning into a ritual. The formula—rich in vitamin C and natural antioxidants—targets pigmentation and fine lines, helps normalize excess sebum, and refreshes the skin without stickiness.

For hydration and natural glow, the formula is enriched with niacinamide and a 10-type hyaluronic acid complex. The toner has a cumulative effect: with regular use, skin can look smoother, healthier, and more radiant.

Bonus: you can soak cotton pads with the toner and apply to dry or irritated areas for a few minutes like a mini sheet mask.

Key ingredients: Niacinamide (Vitamin B3); Lemon Fruit Water; Vitamin Complex; Multi-Molecular Hyaluronic Acid Complex (10 types)

Composition/INCI: Water, Citrus Limon (Lemon) Fruit Water, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Dipropylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Niacinamide, Centella Asiatica Extract, Ficus Carica (Fig) Fruit Extract, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Octyldodeceth-16, Sodium Citrate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Polyglyceryl-10 Stearate, Citric Acid, Disodium EDTA, Ceramide NP, 3-O-Ethyl Ascorbic Acid, Dimethylsilanol Hyaluronate, Retinyl Palmitate, Biotin, Cyanocobalamin, Sodium Acetylated Hyaluronate, Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate, Sodium Hyaluronate Dimethylsilanol, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Ascorbic Acid, Tocopheryl Acetate, Thiamine HCl, Panthenol, Potassium Hyaluronate, Folic Acid, Pyridoxine, Hydroxypropyltrimonium Hyaluronate, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Hyaluronic Acid, Fragrance
how_to_use: Apply to a cotton pad and gently wipe the face along massage lines. For more intense hydration, place soaked pads on the face like a mask for 5–10 minutes. Tip: depending on skin condition, you can apply 2 to 4 layers.

name: PDRN Cica Exosome Serum
text:
FINDIVE — PDRN Cica Exosome Serum

It might sound unexpected, but salmon-derived polynucleotides (PDRN) have become a major Korean skincare trend. They are valued for visible “after first use” effects and for supporting deeper-level skin recovery.

This serum combines a high concentration of salmon DNA (PDRN) with Centella exosomes to help restore the skin, hydrate, and strengthen the barrier. During cold seasons, skin can become red, burning, and highly reactive. The brand reports a cooling effect and a measurable reduction in visible redness after use.

The serum calms quickly and then supports deeper recovery processes. Regular use helps skin look more radiant, improves elasticity, and supports a more resilient protective barrier.

It absorbs fast without greasy shine and contains no added fragrance. Suitable after cosmetic procedures, for sensitive/reactive skin, and for age-related changes.

Key ingredients: Astaxanthin; TECA; PDRN; Centella Exosomes (1000 ppm); Oligo; Melaway™ 1%

Composition/INCI: Water, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Niacinamide, 1,2-Hexanediol, Sodium DNA, Xylitol, Betaine, Sodium Polyacrylate, Xanthan Gum, Ethylhexylglycerin, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Adenosine, Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Disodium EDTA, Dextrin, PVM/MA Copolymer, Pyrus Communis (Pear) Fruit Extract, Nymphaea Alba Flower Extract, Malus Domestica Fruit Extract, Backhousia Citriodora Leaf Extract, Erythritol, Rosa Damascena Flower Water, Sea Water, Iris Florentina Root Extract, Cucumis Melo (Melon) Fruit Extract, Gardenia Florida Fruit Extract, Polyglyceryl-3 Methylglucose Distearate, Hedera Helix (Ivy) Leaf/Stem Extract, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Methyl Glucose Sesquistearate, Cetearyl Glucoside, Centella Asiatica Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Astaxanthin, Bifida Ferment Lysate, Lactococcus Ferment Lysate, Lactobacillus Ferment Lysate, Dipropylene Glycol, Hyaluronic Acid, Hydrolyzed Collagen, Panthenol, Asiaticoside, Asiatic Acid, Madecassic Acid, Beta-Glucan, Ceramide NP
how_to_use: Press the pump 2–3 times and spread the serum over the skin. For targeted care, apply to the problem area and allow to absorb. Finish with a moisturizer.

name: Luxury Aquvo Tension Cream
text:
Rebloom — Luxury Aquvo Tension Cream

Rebloom products are distributed through selected Seoul aesthetic clinics and produced in limited batches. The line is positioned as clean and premium, focused on “reviving” natural beauty through potent yet thoughtful ingredients.

Luxury Aquvo Tension Cream is built on deep sea minerals and “jade water” (nephrite extract). The texture feels like whipped butter, and a high concentration of functional components nourishes and comforts the skin.

Fermented filtrates support the skin microbiome, radiance, tone evenness, and help manage excess sebum. A peptide complex supports firmness and collagen synthesis, while shea butter, olive oil, and beeswax help protect against moisture loss and environmental irritation.

Key ingredients: Deep Sea Water; Allantoin; Multi-Molecular Hyaluronic Acid Complex (5 types); Nephrite Extract

Composition/INCI: Water, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Cetearyl Alcohol, Beeswax, 1.2-Hexanediol, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Polysorbate 60, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Dimethicone, Tocopheryl Acetate, Sea Water, Linalool, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Bifida Ferment Filtrate, Copper Tripeptide-1, Nephrite Extract, Schizophyllan, Caprylyl Glycol, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Allantoin, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Saccharomyces Ferment Filtrate, Laureth-8, Pentapeptide-3, Sorbitan Olivate, Cetearyl Olivate, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-5, Hexyl Cinnamal, Pentylene Glycol, Limonene, Hyaluronic Acid, Sodium Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Fragrance, Galactomyces Ferment Filtrate, Hydroxycitronellal, Glyceryl Caprylate, Dipropylene Glycol, Citronellol, Butylphenyl Methylpropional, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Palmitoyl Pentapeptide-4, Sodium Hyaluronate, Hydrolyzed Collagen
how_to_use: Apply a small amount and spread evenly with gentle patting motions. If needed, apply an additional layer to very dry areas.

name: Youth Enhance Total Recovery Eye Cream
text:
La Pianta — Youth Enhance Total Recovery Eye Cream

The most delicate, vulnerable skin is around the eyes. It contains fewer lipids, is prone to dryness, and is more likely to develop fine lines and puffiness.

This restorative eye cream features high-activity peptides, patented ingredients, and antioxidants designed to support density and resilience. The patented Number6 component (based on avocado extract) is formulated for intensive yet gentle care. It helps reduce the appearance of dark circles, supports de-puffing, promotes skin renewal, and helps protect from oxidative stress.

The brand reports clinically measured improvements during testing.

Key ingredients: Ceramide Complex (6 types); Adenosine; Number6; Antioxidant Complex; Niacinamide; Hyaluronic Acid; Peptide Complex

Composition/INCI: Water, Propanediol, Glycerin, Cetearyl Alcohol, Butylene Glycol Dicaprylate/Dicaprate, Squalane, 1.2-Hexanediol, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Niacinamide, Octyldodecanol, Behenyl Alcohol, Cyclopentasiloxane, Butylene Glycol, Arachidyl Alcohol, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, C14-22 Alcohols, Panthenol, Cyclohexasiloxane, Glyceryl Stearate, Myristyl Myristate, Polyacrylate-13, Arachidyl Glucoside, Palmitic Acid, Polyisobutene, Stearic Acid, Carbomer, C12-20 Alkyl Glucoside, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Tromethamine, Tocopherol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hydrolyzed Gardenia Florida Extract, Hydrolyzed Malt Extract, Adenosine, Hydrolyzed Viola Tricolor Extract, Polysorbate 20, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Sorbitan Isostearate, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Fruit Extract, Coptis Japonica Root Extract, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Extract, Sodium Polyacrylate, Zea Mays (Corn) Kernel Extract, Disodium EDTA, Dextrin, Arbutin, Hyaluronic Acid, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate, Glucose, Myristic Acid, Fructan, Hydrolyzed Elastin, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Hydrolyzed Collagen, Caffeine, Dipeptide Diaminobutyroyl Benzylamide, Glutathione, Hippophae Rhamnoides Oil, Soluble Collagen, Ubiquinone, Polyglyceryl-10 Diisostearate, Ceramide NP, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Cholesterol, Phytosphingosine, Ceramide NG, Ceramide NS, Ceramide AP, Ceramide AS, Tripeptide-3, Acetyl Hexapeptide-8, Acetyl Octapeptide-3, Atelocollagen, Copper Tripeptide-1, Palmitoyl Pentapeptide-4, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, rh-Polypeptide-1, rh-Oligopeptide-1, rh-Oligopeptide-2, rh-Polypeptide-62, rh-Polypeptide-3, Tripeptide-1, Tripeptide-2, Astaxanthin, Ceramide EOP
how_to_use: Apply a small amount along the orbital bone around the eyes and gently distribute with fingertips.

name: Super Collagen Wrapping Mask
text:
AROCELL — Super Collagen Wrapping Mask

This mask earns the title of the most dramatic product in the box: it contains six types of collagen. After application, within minutes it forms a lightweight transparent film that wraps the skin and helps reduce transepidermal water loss.

The next-generation formula focuses on texture refinement and intensive hydration. It “seals” moisture to help skin look plumper and healthier in colder seasons. It supports firmness and helps improve the appearance of gravitational aging—often with noticeable results after the first use.

The collagen system includes:
— hydrolyzed collagen
— low-molecular collagen
— nano collagen
— three types of plant collagen

Niacinamide, the patented brightening component MELAVEIL, and gentle PHA exfoliation complement the formula to help even tone and support a smoother surface.

Key ingredients: MELAVEIL™; Hydrolyzed Collagen; Low-Molecular Collagen; Niacinamide; Plant Collagen Complex; PHA; Nano Collagen

Composition/INCI: Water, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Methylpropanediol, Polyvinyl Alcohol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Niacinamide, 1,2-Hexanediol, Algin, Polysorbate 60, Polyglyceryl-10 Oleate, Sodium Polystyrene Sulfonate, Cellulose Gum, Glyceryl Stearate, Stearalkonium Hectorite, PEG-100 Stearate, Propylene Carbonate, Butylene Glycol, Calendula Officinalis Flower, Ethylhexylglycerin, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Adenosine, Citrus Aurantifolia (Lime) Oil, Citrus Paradisi (Grapefruit) Peel Oil, Disodium EDTA, Citrus Limon (Lemon) Peel Oil, Lavandula Hybrida Oil, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Oil, Malus Domestica Fruit Extract, Nymphaea Alba Flower Extract, Backhousia Citriodora Leaf Extract, Hydrolyzed Gardenia Florida Extract, Maltodextrin, Glycerin, Hydrolyzed Extensin, Gluconolactone, Polycaprolactone, Hydrolyzed Collagen, Collagen Extract, Tocopherol, Ricinus Communis (Castor) Seed Oil, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Pullulan, sh-Polypeptide-121, Acetyl Glucosamine, Palmitoyl Hexapeptide-12, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Peptide, Collagen, Collagen Amino Acids, Sodium Soy Hydrolyzed Collagen, Zinc Hydrolyzed Collagen, Soluble Collagen, Limonene, Linalool, Citral, Geraniol
how_to_use: Spread evenly over the face, avoiding the eye and lip areas. Wait 20–30 minutes until a clear film forms. Peel off the mask starting from the edges. Use 2–3 times per week; daily use is acceptable. Tip: can also be applied to the neck and hands.

name: EcPorin 10000 Sheet Mask
text:
Feld Apotheke — EcPorin 10000 Sheet Mask

If stress resilience were a skincare product, it would be this sheet mask. The core is 10,000 ppm of EcPorin™—an ingredient found in microorganisms that survive extreme environments such as deserts and glaciers.

This patented complex helps the skin adapt to external stress and supports cellular recovery processes.

What it does: we affectionately call it a “skin plantain leaf”—you apply it, and irritated skin looks calmer and more comfortable. When in contact with water, EcPorin™ forms a moisturizing protective layer that quickly helps reduce visible redness and sensitivity.

A high concentration helps even the look of tone and support the lipid barrier, while the formula is designed to deliver hydration rapidly. EcPorin™ supports the skin’s defense potential.

The manufacturer indicates suitability from age 14, including for skin prone to acne.

Key ingredients: Caprylyl Glycol; EcPorin™ (10,000 ppm); Mild Surfactant; Hyaluronic Acid; Houttuynia Cordata Extract; Marine Fermented Complex + Salicornia; Centella Asiatica

Composition/INCI: Water, Dipropylene Glycol, Glycerin, Glycereth-26, Salicornia Herbacea Extract, Butylene Glycol, Betaine, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, 1,2-Hexanediol, Paeonia Suffruticosa Root Extract, Centella Asiatica Extract, Carbomer, Polyglyceryl-10 Laurate, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Tromethamine, Ectoin, Glyceryl Caprylate, Xanthan Gum, Ethylhexylglycerin, Disodium EDTA, Lecithin, Tocopherol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Polyglyceryl-4 Caprate, Stearic Acid, Diethylhexyl Sodium Sulfosuccinate, Caprylyl Glycol, Tamarindus Indica Seed Polysaccharide, Trehalose, Myrothamnus Flabellifolia Leaf Extract
how_to_use: Separate the mask from the mesh layer (discard the mesh). Apply the mask for 10–20 minutes, then remove and gently pat the remaining essence over the face and neck. Single use.

name: Korean Spa Exfoliating Mitt
text:
Korean Spa Exfoliating Mitt

The very same mitt best described by 82Box customers:

“ I use it every day, and now it looks like chewed gum. So bad that my husband threw it away. Many times. And yes, of course I took it out of the trash. Every time.”

“The mitt in the set is amazing. Just a little cloth, but it works miracles. No words. I showed it off to the family and regretted it. I should have guarded it like the apple of my eye.”

And here’s a bit more: this authentic rectangular exfoliating mitt is used in traditional Korean spas for body scrubbing. Made of 100% viscose, it develops a textured, “grainy” surface when wet.

Massage with this mitt not only exfoliates but also supports microcirculation and lymphatic drainage. Scrub steamed skin in the shower, bath, or sauna once a week—and after about a month you may notice skin looks firmer and the appearance of cellulite is reduced. To enhance the effect, apply a generous moisturizer after each session.
how_to_use: Turn the mitt inside out. Steam the skin in the shower or bath. Wet the mitt and do not apply any cleansers to it. Massage the body until dead skin rolls off. Do not use on the face or décolleté. Avoid use if the skin is irritated or damaged. Hand-wash the mitt with a mild detergent.

title: Retinol and cosmetic retinoids
text: Retinol is a well-studied vitamin A derivative that increases cell turnover, stimulates collagen synthesis and improves skin texture and tone. It is effective for anti-aging and post-acne concerns but may cause irritation if misused.
notes: Use only at night. Start 1–2 times per week and increase gradually. Daily SPF is mandatory.

title: Niacinamide (Vitamin B3)
text: Niacinamide is a multifunctional ingredient that strengthens the skin barrier, regulates sebum, reduces inflammation and helps even out skin tone.
notes: Well tolerated by most skin types, including sensitive and acne-prone skin.

title: Hyaluronic Acid
text: Hyaluronic acid is a powerful humectant that attracts and retains water in the skin, improving hydration and plumpness.
notes: Apply on damp skin and seal with an occlusive moisturizer.

title: Ceramides
text: Ceramides are lipids naturally present in the skin barrier. They help prevent moisture loss and protect against environmental stressors.
notes: Suitable for daily use and all skin types.

title: Panthenol (Provitamin B5)
text: Panthenol soothes irritated skin, enhances barrier recovery and improves hydration.
notes: Excellent ingredient during active treatments and post-procedure care.

title: Allantoin
text: Allantoin is a soothing agent that promotes skin comfort and supports healing.
notes: Suitable for sensitive and compromised skin.

title: Centella Asiatica
text: Centella Asiatica is a calming botanical extract known for its anti-inflammatory and healing properties.
notes: Ideal for sensitive, acne-prone and post-procedure skin.

title: Salicylic Acid (BHA)
text: Salicylic acid is an oil-soluble exfoliant that penetrates pores and helps reduce acne and congestion.
notes: Do not overuse. Can be drying if combined with other actives.

title: Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid)
text: Vitamin C is a potent antioxidant that brightens skin tone and protects against environmental damage.
notes: Prefer morning use under sunscreen.

title: Bakuchiol
text: Bakuchiol is a plant-derived retinol alternative that provides anti-aging benefits with lower irritation risk.
notes: Suitable for sensitive skin and daytime use.

title: Adenosine
text: Adenosine is a bioactive ingredient with proven anti-wrinkle properties that improves skin smoothness and elasticity.
notes: Commonly used in anti-aging formulations, suitable for sensitive skin.

title: Peptide Complex
text: Peptides are signaling molecules that support collagen synthesis and skin repair.
notes: Work best with long-term, consistent use.

title: Green Tea Extract
text: Green tea extract is a potent antioxidant with anti-inflammatory and sebum-regulating properties.
notes: Especially beneficial for oily and acne-prone skin.

title: Propolis Extract
text: Propolis is a bee-derived ingredient with antibacterial and barrier-supporting properties.
notes: May not be suitable for people with bee product allergies.

title: Snail Secretion Filtrate
text: Snail secretion filtrate supports skin regeneration, hydration and texture repair.
notes: Suitable for most skin types, including sensitive.

title: Ectoin
text: Ectoin is a stress-protection molecule that improves skin resilience and hydration.
notes: Very well tolerated and suitable for compromised skin.

title: Zinc Oxide
text: Zinc oxide provides soothing, anti-inflammatory effects and physical UV protection.
notes: Common in sunscreens and acne-care products.

title: Activated Charcoal
text: Charcoal absorbs excess sebum and impurities from the skin surface.
notes: Best for occasional use on oily or congested skin.

title: Bentonite Clay
text: Bentonite is a natural clay that absorbs oil and impurities.
notes: Can be drying if overused.

title: Calamine
text: Calamine soothes irritated skin and helps reduce redness.
notes: Often used in spot treatments and calming masks.

title: Squalane
text: Squalane is a lightweight emollient that mimics skin’s natural lipids.
notes: Non-comedogenic and suitable for all skin types.

title: Tocopherol (Vitamin E)
text: Vitamin E is an antioxidant that supports barrier function and protects against free radicals.
notes: Enhances stability of vitamin C formulations.

title: Tranexamic Acid
text: Tranexamic acid helps reduce pigmentation by inhibiting melanin pathways.
notes: Suitable for long-term use.

title: Beta-Glucan
text: Beta-glucan is a soothing polysaccharide that enhances skin repair and hydration.
notes: Often compared to hyaluronic acid for hydration benefits.

title: Basic routine for all skin types: cleanse, moisturize, protect
steps: Morning: cleanse with a gentle, skin-friendly cleanser (or a mild gel/foam) and avoid over-cleansing.
Apply a moisturizer suited to your skin type to maintain hydration and barrier comfort.
Finish with sunscreen SPF30+ (preferably broad UVA/UVB protection) as the last step before makeup.
Evening: remove SPF/makeup thoroughly (use an oil-based cleanser first if wearing sunscreen), then follow with a gentle water-based cleanser.
Moisturize again to restore comfort after cleansing and support the skin barrier.
text: This routine covers the three essentials—cleansing, moisturizing, and sun protection. Keeping these steps consistent usually delivers the biggest improvements in skin comfort, barrier strength, and long-term aging prevention.

title: Evening cleansing routine for SPF and makeup: double cleansing
steps: Step 1 (evening): remove makeup and sunscreen with an oil-based cleanser (cleansing oil or balm) or another effective first-cleanse product.
Focus on areas where SPF/makeup accumulates (sides of nose, jawline, hairline) but avoid aggressive rubbing.
Step 2: follow with a gentle water-based cleanser (gel/foam/milk cleanser) to remove residues.
Rinse with lukewarm water and avoid hot water to prevent dryness and irritation.
Moisturize after cleansing to support barrier recovery.
text: Double cleansing is a practical approach when you wear sunscreen and/or makeup. Oil-based first cleansing is typically the most reliable way to dissolve SPF, followed by a mild second cleanse to remove leftover residues without stripping the skin.

title: Gentle cleansing routine: avoid 'squeaky clean' and tightness
steps: Choose a mild facial cleanser that cleans thoroughly but does not leave the skin feeling tight or dry.
Avoid cleansing until the skin feels 'squeaky clean'—this is a sign of over-stripping.
Use lukewarm water; avoid hot water to reduce barrier damage and redness.
After cleansing, apply moisturizer promptly to restore comfort and hydration.
If you cleanse more than once per day, consider lighter, gentler formulas for additional washes.
text: Cleansing should remove impurities without damaging the hydrolipid barrier. A 'tight' or 'squeaky' finish often indicates over-cleansing, which can worsen sensitivity and lead to rebound oiliness or irritation.

title: pH-friendly cleansing and why moisturizing after washing matters
steps: Use a facial cleanser formulated for the face (avoid bar soap and harsh body cleansers).
Prefer gentle cleansers that are marketed as pH-balanced or skin-friendly (often around pH ~5.5).
Remember that even rinsing with water can temporarily affect skin pH and barrier comfort.
Apply moisturizer after cleansing to reduce tightness and support barrier function.
If you are acne-prone, do not compensate with harsher cleansing—use targeted actives instead.
text: Skin surface pH is linked to barrier performance and comfort. Cleansing can shift pH temporarily, so moisturizing after washing is a practical step to reduce dryness and maintain resilience—especially for sensitive or dry skin.

title: Micellar water routine: use it correctly and rinse when possible
steps: Use micellar water to remove light makeup or as a first step in the evening if desired.
Do not rely on micellar water as the only cleansing step when wearing sunscreen or heavier makeup.
Rinse micellar water off with water when possible or follow with a gentle water-based cleanser.
Moisturize after cleansing to prevent dryness and irritation.
Reserve 'no-rinse' use only for exceptional situations when washing is impossible.
text: Micellar water contains cleansing surfactants organized into micelles. Residues can remain on the skin if you do not rinse or follow with a cleanser, so rinsing (or double cleansing) is generally the safer approach for barrier comfort.

title: Skincare hygiene routine: hands and face towel rules
steps: Wash your hands before touching your face, cleansing, or applying skincare.
Use a dedicated face towel and wash it frequently.
If possible, pat dry with disposable paper towels or allow the skin to air-dry.
Avoid rubbing the face with a damp, reused towel.
If you are acne-prone or sensitive, treat towel hygiene as part of your routine.
text: Basic hygiene reduces unnecessary irritation and bacterial transfer. Clean hands and a fresh face towel can meaningfully improve comfort and reduce the risk of inflammation, especially for acne-prone or sensitive skin.

title: Moisturizing routine: morning and evening, barrier-first approach
steps: Apply moisturizer morning and evening, and after cleansing if you wash again during the day.
Choose the texture based on skin type and season (gel/fluids for lighter feel, creams for richer comfort).
Focus on the four functions: hydration support, water retention, nourishment, and occlusion to reduce moisture loss.
If skin feels tight after cleansing, prioritize barrier-supporting moisturizers and avoid harsh cleansing.
If you use strong actives (retinoids/acids), buffer with barrier-support ingredients and adjust frequency.
text: Moisturizing is not only about 'adding cream'—it supports hydration, comfort and barrier function. Consistent moisturizing helps prevent dehydration, dullness, and impaired renewal across all ages and skin types.

title: Moisturizing routine for dry skin: nourishment + occlusion
steps: Morning and evening: use a richer nourishing cream that prevents moisture loss and supports the barrier.
Look for barrier-support cues such as ceramides and lipid-replenishing formulas; combine with hydrating layers if needed.
If you feel persistent tightness, apply moisturizer on slightly damp skin and consider an occlusive layer in colder seasons.
Avoid overly hot water and harsh cleansing that can worsen dryness.
If flaking persists, consider gentle AHA-based exfoliation occasionally (not daily) and prioritize recovery care.
text: Dry skin benefits from richer textures and barrier-focused formulas that reduce transepidermal water loss. The goal is long-lasting comfort through nourishment and occlusion rather than frequent reapplication.

title: Moisturizing routine for normal skin: choose texture by preference
steps: Morning and evening: apply a moisturizer that feels comfortable and does not over-dry or overload the skin.
Choose a lighter, water-based texture for faster absorption and a fresh feel, or a more emollient texture for softness.
Keep the rest of the routine minimal: gentle cleansing + daily SPF is often enough.
Adjust texture seasonally (richer in cold weather, lighter in heat).
Avoid unnecessary over-layering if your skin is stable and comfortable.
text: Normal skin typically does well with consistent basics and a moisturizer texture chosen for comfort and climate. Seasonal adjustments are often more important than adding many active layers.

title: Moisturizing routine for combination skin: zone-based strategy
steps: Use a lighter moisturizer on oilier zones (typically T-zone) and a richer moisturizer on drier zones (cheeks/mouth area).
Adapt textures seasonally: richer in winter, lighter in summer.
Do not over-strip oily areas with harsh cleansing; prioritize gentle cleansing and balanced hydration.
If congestion is present, address it with targeted actives rather than aggressive cleansing.
Keep SPF daily; choose a comfortable texture to avoid skipping protection.
text: Combination skin often responds best to a two-texture approach rather than forcing one product to fit all zones. Zone-based hydration prevents both dryness and rebound oiliness.

title: Moisturizing routine for oily skin: hydrate to reduce rebound oiliness
steps: Use a lightweight but nourishing moisturizer (gel-cream/fluid) to prevent dehydration.
Avoid overly aggressive 'for oily skin' products that strip the barrier and may increase sebum production.
If helpful, choose formulas that include sebum-support ingredients (e.g., niacinamide and zinc) while keeping texture light.
In summer, a sufficiently moisturizing sunscreen can sometimes replace moisturizer to avoid overloading.
Do not use harsh cleansing as an acne strategy; use targeted actives (e.g., BHA) cautiously instead.
text: Oily skin still needs hydration. Under-moisturizing can trigger dehydration-driven sebum increase, while balanced hydration supports comfort and may improve overall oil control.

title: Daily SPF routine: how to choose, apply, and reapply
steps: Use SPF as the final skincare step in the morning (before makeup).
Choose SPF30+ for daily use; prefer broad UVA/UVB coverage markings when possible (e.g., PA++++, broad spectrum, UVA mark).
Apply generously: build coverage with 2–3 thin layers or one sufficient layer, then allow it to set for a few minutes.
Reapply every 1.5–2 hours during strong outdoor exposure; if not possible, aim to reapply at least once during the day.
If swimming, reapply after each time you come out of the water even if the product is water-resistant.
text: UV exposure is a key driver of photoaging and contributes to skin cancer risk. Correct SPF use depends on adequate quantity and reapplication, not only on the product label.

title: Additional and active care routine: toners, serums, masks (safe layering)
steps: After cleansing: apply toner/essence/lotion/booster depending on your goal (hydration, exfoliation, microbiome support).
If using multiple toners: apply exfoliating toner first, then hydrating/supportive layers.
Hydrating toners can be used daily; exfoliating toners should be introduced slowly (start 1–2 times per week).
Apply serums after toner and before moisturizer; choose based on your main concern (acne, pigmentation, anti-aging, etc.).
Do not stack multiple high-irritation actives in one routine (retinoids + strong acids + strong vitamin C) especially if you are a beginner or sensitive.
text: Additional care supports the basic routine, while active care targets specific concerns and may use higher concentrations of actives. Safe layering and slow introduction are key to preventing irritation.

title: Mask routine: categories and safe weekly frequency
steps: Choose masks by goal: cleansing (clay/charcoal), exfoliating (acids/enzymes), hydrating (sheet/hydrogel/cream), nourishing (ceramides/oils), sleeping masks, or active masks (peptides/vitamins/extracts).
Use most masks no more than 2–3 times per week unless the product instructions state otherwise.
If your skin becomes irritated, reduce frequency and switch to soothing/hydrating masks until comfort returns.
Avoid combining an exfoliating mask with other strong actives in the same routine.
Treat masking as a supportive step, not a replacement for daily basics (moisturizer + SPF).
text: Masks can be helpful additions but are easy to overuse. A moderate schedule (typically 2–3 times weekly) reduces the risk of barrier disruption and irritation.

title: Anti-aging routine: SPF-first, then targeted actives as tolerated
steps: Morning: prioritize daily SPF as the core anti-aging step (photoaging prevention).
Maintain a stable base: gentle cleansing + consistent moisturizing for barrier support.
Add antioxidants for prevention-focused care (e.g., vitamin C in the morning if tolerated).
Introduce stronger actives gradually (retinoids at night; exfoliating acids 1–2 times per week if needed).
Avoid introducing multiple strong actives at once; balance active steps with barrier-support ingredients and adjust frequency based on tolerance.
text: Anti-aging is driven heavily by cumulative UV exposure, so SPF is the foundation. Actives can improve texture and fine lines, but long-term success depends on tolerance, gradual introduction, and consistent barrier support.

title: Eye area routine: hydration, gentle anti-aging, and safe application
steps: Treat the eye area as more delicate: prioritize hydration and barrier comfort first.
If using an eye cream, apply it before your face moisturizer.
Use the ring finger and tap gently; do not stretch the skin.
Apply along the orbital bone: under-eye from outer corner to inner; above the eye under the brow from inner to outer.
If puffiness or dark circles are persistent and severe, consider medical evaluation to rule out non-cosmetic causes.
text: The eye area has thinner skin and fewer oil glands, making it more prone to dryness and fine lines. Gentle technique and consistent hydration are often more important than aggressive actives in this zone.
